body_html:
I guess what @gunan is rightfully asking: what does this buy us? Does it lead to

  • less/easier modification of CMAKE files in cases of changes to the code
  • better tests/errors in case of changes that would break the CMAKE build
    or some other advantage?

better tests/errors in case of changes that would break the CMAKE build
or some other advantage?
body:
I guess what @gunan is rightfully asking: what does this buy us? Does it lead to
- less/easier modification of CMAKE files in cases of changes to the code
- better tests/errors in case of changes that would break the CMAKE build
or some other advantage?
